storyInfo: In order to make way for new cultivars, the Convalescent Garden has to clear out a batch of plants. Does wilting or being plucked spell the end of a flower's life? Podenco finds new answers.

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Convalescent Garden
10:00 A.M. \ Sunny, clear
Podenco.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh, Miss Lena, you're here.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Look at the golden chrysanthemums planter over that way. It's long past their forty-day flowering period, but they still aren't wilting.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: And look at these yarny velvets. One of the yarn balls grew a layer more than usual, and the layers are all much more distinct too.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Making the right changes to a plants' nutrient intake can prolong or shorten their flowering seasons. Weren't you trying to tweak the formula of your nutrient solution?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Um, do you think you could you invite the Doctor here this weekend? They weren't here last time we did the flower display, and they've regretted missing it all this time.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Um, what's wrong?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Podenco, we might need to... get rid of these flowers.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Medical's taken on several new research projects recently, and they'll need us to provide specimen samples in bulk. Here's the list—I've already been over it with Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: There are some varieties we've never raised before, and some with extremely long life cycles. We'll be in trouble unless we start work as soon as we can.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: But the Convalescent Garden only has so much room.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Will we have to... pluck them all?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: We won't need to go that far. As long as we dedicate some space to cultivation, we'll be fine.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Can I move them to my own dorm then?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: With this many flowers, even ten dormitories wouldn't be enough.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Didn't you send Engineering an application to expand the Garden before?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: That still hasn't been approved. They're busy with other refurbishment and maintenance. We'll just have to do something about the flowers near the end of their cycle, along with a few others.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (That's still a lot, though.)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (These yarny velvets and golden chrysanthemums...)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Podenco?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: I'm sorry. I know you've been taking care of them for so long.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: But the Convalescent Garden isn't an ordinary garden.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: It's a 'supplier' for Medical, as well as an 'operating room' for aromatherapy. And it belongs to Rhodes Island, before anything else.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: We cultivate all these plants both because pretty flowers can uplift spirits, and because we hope to make use of them to help everyone in the truest sense.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh, I know that much, Miss Lena. I've had to pluck pretty flowers all the time back home, too.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: ...You've never talked about your home before.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mostly because there's not much to say. Do you still remember the nomadic city where we met for the first time?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I do.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: It was a tiny, faraway place, but it took me a whole month to get there from home.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I think you used to live in a plateau settlement, on the Bolívarian border?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mm-hm. We were living off the land ever since I can remember, not that we had a choice. People barely ever wanted to see what it was like outside. They said it was a mess out there.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: We planted so many crops. At first it was millet, then at some point the adults pulled all the millet out while it was still sprouts, and switched to coffee beans.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: 'Bolívarian coffee.' Not just any bean can lay claim to a whole country's name. The largest cities sell it as a popular souvenir, and the demand is endless both domestic and abroad.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: And so, though masses of its people go hungry, Bolívar still has all sorts of regional policies in place to encourage the growing of cash crops.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: It was completely new to us, so we didn't have experience growing it. And the soil is hard in the plateau, and the drainage is poor. It wasn't good for growing coffee at all.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: All the land in our village was used to plant it, but the harvests were miserable, the beans didn't meet the standard, and the reward wasn't enough to trade for the grains we used to grow.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Watch out, Podenco.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Keep walking and you would've kicked the boronias over.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, sorry.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (But we're going to have to get rid of them anyway.)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Go on.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Later on, we planted a few other cash crops, too, which went about as well as the coffee, until finally we went back to millet.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: But that didn't work either. Every harvest season, we'd get people coming to levy our grains. I couldn't tell you if they were from the Singas dynasty, the Coalition, or True Bolívarians.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Or maybe they were just a bunch of awful people who wandered around the border plateau.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: We could escape Catastrophe, but we couldn't escape them. Our only real option was to develop the wild land and plant more grains.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.text: But whether we were planting coffee beans or millet, we always saw wild flowers in the soil.
Red ones, yellow ones, light pink ones... I didn
They grew all around the fields. They were really beautiful, and they smelled pretty too.
Whenever it was time to water, I
My dad would pluck any left in the ground. So would the others in the village. Afterwards, so would I.

attributes.content: Compared to the coffee beans or the millet, the flowers were nothing more than weeds.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I understand, Podenco.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: But what about after you plucked those flowers?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: After?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: That's right. What did you do with them after?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: There's still a bit more to what I said earlier. We cultivate so many plants, and we do grow pretty flowers to uplift spirits, but also in hopes of making use of them to help everyone in the truest sense.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: But not all plants have medicinal value, or are able to cure the sick. The existence of some flowers is purely to cheer us up.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: But it's not as if flowers grow on branches just to make us happy.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: For them, going from budding to blooming to wilting is nothing more than a natural cycle.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: There's a saying in Minos: 'When a flower blooms on a branch, it is embracing the whole land.'
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: And a Yanese operator once told me they have a poem that goes something like 'petals fall upon the ground, come with the soil, their fragrance still as old'... I can't remember the original exactly.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: In other words, the flowering season comes to a close, but the flowers' lives aren't over yet.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Back home... I'd try air-drying the flowers sometimes, so I could put them up for a while more.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Is that so.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Podenco, I'll help however I can. Let's sort out these flowers together.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Umm... no, it's okay, I want to figure this out by myself.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: The golden chrysanthemums, and yarny velvets, and boronias... I've been looking after all these plants on the south end this whole time.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: All I did for the wild flowers back home was pick them. But now... I think you just helped me figure a lot of things out, Miss Lena.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: ...Alright then. For now, here's the Medical Department's list of new plants. Don't lose it.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Convalescent Garden
The yarny velvets have been air-drying naturally for two days. I think they should be good now.
First, trim away the stems and leaves that are already damaged.
Then apply the desiccant. It's the trickiest but the most important step. Too thin a coating and it won't preserve for long, too thick and it'll completely block their scent.
Once the desiccant is on, stand them in fine sand for... ten minutes—no, fifteen.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (I tried a whole parade of chemicals to find the right ingredient blend for this desiccant. It should work great.)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (Dried flowers don't last very long if you just rely on air-drying—they wither before you know it. Just like the ones from back then...)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (Oh, it would've been so nice to have all this stuff back home.)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Phew—now the desiccant just needs to completely absorb, and it's done.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Podenco?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Miss Lena! What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I'm preparing what I need for aromatherapy. Nyctomaluses only bloom in the dead of morning, and I'm here to collect their pollen.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh! Is it that late already...?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Yarny velvets have quite large flowers, and there's a rich sense of layering between their petals. There's more ornamental value in drying them than you'd think.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: You've treated so many velvets, it's become like a little dried flower shop in here.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh, what's this?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Floral teabags.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Boronia petals?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mm-hm! I saw Rosa drinking tea and the idea just came to me. I've already tried it. The aroma's very strong, plus a tiny bit sweet, and it's easier to brew than tea leaves.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Have you been up since yesterday making all this?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Hehe.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Oh, you must be so tired, Podenco.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: But I'm not done... There are still the couple dozen pots of chrysanthemums left. Their aroma's very mild. It could easily be lost when using special treatments.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: (But I'm sure I can think of something else. I can't just throw them away. Mm-hm.)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Say, why don't you let me help after all?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: It's okay. You assigned me this task, so it's my job now. I'll be sure to see it through.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Mm. Alright.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: I remember you telling me the same thing, the first time we met.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Border of Bolívar, a small nomadic city
Market
3:00 P.M. \ Sunny, clear
Make way! You've been wandering around all day now.
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: Excuse me, is there a botanical garden or exhibition hall here? Where can I find it? It's supposed to be full of fresh flowers, and the booklet said, um, they're in big nomadic cities...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Yeah, in 'big' ones. Not here.
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: What about flower fields, then?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Eugh, look, I'm busy recruiting for the farm. Do your research before you go out on holiday, señorita. This is the Bolívarian border, middle of nowhere, we don't got nothing like that.
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: (I'm not on holiday...)
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: About the farm then—could you let me try? I've just left home, and I don't know where I'm going yet.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: My name's Podenco, and I've been helping in the fields since I was little. I'm familiar with lots of plants, and I've planted seven or eight kinds of crops before. Millet, coffee, hemp, even cocoa trees...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Nursery, irrigation and ventilation, weeding and fertilizing, grafting and transplanting, I can do it all. Trust me.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Hmm.
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: (So she's not some well-to-do kid.)
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: If you're worried about pay, I'd be fine without.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: But I'd like a tiny little plot where I can plant a few of my own flowers.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I've seen so many flowers on the way here I've never seen before, and I've collected heaps of seeds already. They'll make your farm really pretty.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Enough, señorita, I'm busy here. There's plenty of vacant land outside the nomadic cities. You can plant flowers wherever you like.
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: (Can't eat 'em, can't sell 'em either. I'd be better off paying you extra than giving you a plot for flowers... Honestly, some kid you are.)
attributes.name: Farm Owner

attributes.content: Well... excuse me, then. Very sorry to bother you.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Ah! Sorry, so sorry! I didn't step on you, did I?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Can I see the seeds you've collected?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Um?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Sorry, I happened to overhear you just now.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Ah. Um, yes, go ahead.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: A dozen or so bags of flower seeds lie in her backpack. They're carefully sorted by size and color, and wrapped in cotton cloth cut from her clothes to let them breathe.
Lena returns the seeds to the girl before her.
Are you fond of flowers?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mm-hm. I know you can't eat them, or make money with them, but they make the earth so pretty, and they make us all happier too.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: But at the same time, they're so frail, and have trouble blooming, but then they wither so soon too, so nobody who wants to take care of them... I want to become a great gardener.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Podenco, I can provide you a garden, and you can plant whatever flowers you like there.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Really?!
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: What do you need me to do in return, then?
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Love them always, and care for them well. That will be your job.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Podenco stares at Lena.
She gives her head a shake, seemingly lost in thought, deliberating whether she can trust this woman, but in no more than the blink of an eye, she gives a nod.
Just be a good gardener? I'll do it. I'll do everything I can to see my job through.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Alright, then. Come to me if you ever need anything.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Also, try turn in sooner than later. It's very late.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mm-hm. I'll return to the dorms as soon as I put away these dried flowers.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: With the velvets done standing, Podenco lays them out according to petal size.
Sheaf by sheaf, she wraps them up.
By now, the scent of desiccant has vanished. A floral perfume fills the whole room.
Three days later
Rhodes Island, Perfumer's dormitory
Lena pushes the door open.
On the table is a bouquet of dried yarny velvets, and a delicately wrapped paper bag. As soon as the fastener on the side is opened, a floral scent pervades Lena's nose.
She opens it up, and inside are boronia teabags and a box of cookies.
Ah, Miss Lena. Have you seen Podenco?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I just got back from the Logistics Department. Is she not in the Garden? What do you need?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: She gave me a giant floral gift package, and disappeared before I could thank her.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: A floral gift package?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Flower cookies, floral tea, and dried flowers. Haha—the same one you have right there. I'm guessing everyone on the landship has one by now.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I hear she gave HR a whole stack of office paper, too, dyed in all different colors with flower extract.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I want to find her and tell her how delicious the cookies were!
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Gold chrysanthemum stamens, chopped up evenly throughout the dough. Baked with care to not only not ruin the texture, but let the fragrance make them that much more appetizing.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (So in the end, she thought of turning the chrysanthemums into desserts. Now that was a good idea.)
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Did she ask you to help her, Blue?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: I didn't help her with anything. I just taught her how to make cookies. All credit goes to her for figuring out how to add fresh flowers.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: All I said was that it should be fine.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Anyway, give her my thanks if you see her.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh, and let me know if you ever need help at the Garden, too.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Lena! Hey there, Miss In-Your-Dorm-For-Once. Anyway, this is for you.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Construction work to expand the Convalescent Garden, approved. Dr. Amiya already signed off.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We'll move some of the energy storage facilities to another part of the ship, and that should give you plenty more floorspace. We'll start the evaluation next week, and if all's good, it's hammer time.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Why so suddenly?
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Is it? You've applied, like, a couple of times already.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: But you never gave it the nod...
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Well, I was pretty tied up before.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: There's been a bunch of operators requesting to expand the Garden, lately. Blue Poison, for one... Honestly, I expected her apply for more ovens.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Rhodes needs a bigger chill-out area, anyway. The gaming room and the Garden are both getting cramped. And obviously, 'let's expand the gaming room' ain't exactly an idea with legs.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Oh, yeah, I got an application from a Convalescent Garden op too.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It said you had to clear out a whole bunch of plants and stuff before you could cultivate what Medical needed.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It also said she was willing to make her own dorm part of the expansion, and she could move the arbors in herself for max plant care convenience.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Podenco...
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Point is, we summed up our ops' views and reached this conclusion. Not to mention Medical needs more stuff by the day—expanding the Garden was always on Engineering's agenda.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Thank you, Closure.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: No problemo! And I mean, who could refuse flower cookies AND flower tea that good, you know? Plus, I got a double portion!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Convalescent Garden
Summer wisteria, fire croton, hiemalgrass... mille-feuille artemesia...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Suramakula, Yamakaphala...
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Oh, Miss Lena, you're here.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I just double-checked all the species and quantities.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I've verified them myself. The labelling for all the necessary water and soil nutrient ratios is fine. This new batch of plants for Medical is settling in well.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh, you must be so tired, Podenco.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: You too, Miss Lena.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: We'll need to ask Procurement for two additional orders of nutrient solution.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: That reminds me, Podenco. The Engineering Department gave the expansion application the go-ahead.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Really?!
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Mm-hmm.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: That’s amazing!
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: We'll be twice as big. We're also planning to build two new PRTS-assisted smart greenhouses, specifically catered to the cultivation and exhibition of flowers.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: And you, Podenco, will be in charge of managing them.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Huh? Me? But I'm just an ordinary gardener.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: I know you can handle it.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: You always see the job through to the end.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: But once construction is done, other operators will be dropping by to relax day in, day out. They'll need to be welcomed properly, and we'll only grow busier with cultivation.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: I-I could move straight into the Garden, then.
attributes.name: Podenco

attributes.content: Hahah. Taking care of flowers starts with taking good care of yourself. Don't mind me, now, I'll be going to see Closure about ordering that nutrient solution.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Oh, and Podenco, your cookies were delicious.
attributes.name: Perfumer

attributes.content: Mm!
attributes.name: Podenco
